programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders head for an auction in Costa Mesa, where they encounter several new faces. Brandi and Jarrod look for stock to sell in their new shop.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick saddles up and heads out to look at a 1980s Sigma Derby horse racing game, but it remains to be seen whether it will be worth a gamble.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chum is over the moon when a pair of 1960s space robot toys arrive at the shop, but the owners asking price may bring him back down to Earth.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les causes a stir when he tells a woman her gold bracelet is fake, and Seth later struggles to determine whether a watch is priceless or worthless.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les makes a decision on impulse that threatens to backfire, and later gives a big loan to a customer with a dubious sob story.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick and the team try to restore a 1960s Nasa helmet, and a rusty gas cart is in need of transformation.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick and the team renovate a 1940s chocolate dispenser to a tight deadline, before turning their attention to a 1950s fridge.

programme.title: Search for the Lost Giants
programme.desc: Brothers Jim and Bill Vieira investigate accounts of giant skeletons being found across America, to determine if these stories are true and who the bones belonged to.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: The 1980 murder of 67-year-old Elizabeth Crossman in the California town of Hemet - and how it took 33 years to convict her killer.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: New store owner Lesa gets started on running the business, while Ricky and Bubba examine a vintage air compressor and Moe discovers some stunning lithographs.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders face tough competition when they find themselves up against 100 rivals at an auction in Longview.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les struggles to forgive Seth for trying to sell his business and decides to lock himself in the office. Meanwhile, a fight breaks out on the shop floor.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les faces a dilemma over the authenticity of a rare guitar and, with no expert on hand for advice, he is forced to go with his gut instinct.

programme.title: Search for the Lost Giants
programme.desc: Brothers Jim and Bill Vieira investigate accounts of giant skeletons being found across America, to determine if these stories are true and who the bones belonged to.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The team from UFO Magazine investigate investigates videos indicating a strong UFO surveillance presence at weapons laboratories.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: An investigation into whether advanced technologies, such as lasers and sonic weapons, are merely rediscovered tools used by advanced beings in the past.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick Wade restores a toy train, but has to overcome various obstacles to keep the project on track, and a 1948 popcorn machine is spruced up.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick Wade and the team gamble on returning a Prohibition-era slot machine to its former glory, and restore a 1930s cola cooler.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Two rare and huge GI Joe playsets are deployed to the shop on the outskirts of Las Vegas.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A letter said to be signed by Napoleon makes Rick stand to attention. Other items under consideration include a surreal figure by Mexican artist Pedro Friedeberg, a 1960s Monkees talking puppet and original Dick & Jane illustrations.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders attend an auction in Laguna Niguel, where Barry buys a mysterious safe with unknown contents and Jarrod and Brandi acquire a collection of toys.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry is accompanied by two beautiful women to the auction, while newcomers Rene and Casey purchase a statue that could be worth thousands of dollars. Elsewhere, a professional wrestler appears at an appraisal.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: The Good, the Bad and the Hungry
programme.desc: A locker belonging to a deceased tycoon goes up for auction, and all the bidders are determined to get their hands on its contents.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders attend an auction in Burelson, where they set out to find items of value among huge truckloads of strange oddities.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: After two turbulent nautically themed rounds, two bladesmiths head the final round to forge the Kachin Dao, a deadly headhunting sword.

programme.title: Pirate Treasure of the Knights Templar
programme.desc: A priceless relic of a statue of Christ unearthed on a shipwreck in Madagascar launches dive expert Barry Clifford and historian Scott Wolter on a worldwide investigation to find out if there is a link between two of history's most legendary sects - 17th-century pirates and the medieval Knights Templar.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The team from UFO Magazine investigates what appear to be underwater landing strips and other strange evidence in the wake of UFO sightings in Florida.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The alleged existence of underground extraterrestrial lairs, concentrating on a cave in Ecuador said to hold alien knowledge, and a hidden city in Turkey.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley reacts to some bad manners in the shop queue, a kooky cowboy arrives at the counter and Rich makes an error that could cost him his job.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds are forced to take action when they witness a hustler scamming their customers in the car park. Plus, Seth and Ashley finally come to blows.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders attend a locker auction at El Monte, California, where Jarrod and Brandi find their sense of charity and Barry unearths a bag that has him hitting the slopes.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: In Compton, Mike buys something that Herb does not want to be anywhere near. Jarrod ends up with a new nickname while Barry and his old pal Kenny reunite.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A 1969 Triumph Motorcycle gets Rick's engine roaring, but it remains to be seen whether he will make an offer the buyer cannot refuse.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A set of 1814 naval history books from John Adams' personal library sails into the shop.

programme.title: Spiky Gold Hunters
programme.desc: Itâ€™s all hands on deck as the divers work relentlessly to collect tonnes of urchin. But as the weather deteriorates, one of the crew gets a scare from below the surface..

programme.title: Monster Croc Wrangler
programme.desc: The team attempts to move 30 crocodiles away from local cattle in just one week.

programme.title: Monster Croc Wrangler
programme.desc: Time is running out as Matt and the boys continue their quest to catch 30 crocodiles in the Northern Territory's Mary River in just one week.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders attend an auction in Laguna Niguel, where Barry buys a mysterious safe with unknown contents and Jarrod and Brandi acquire a collection of toys.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry is accompanied by two beautiful women to the auction, while newcomers Rene and Casey purchase a statue that could be worth thousands of dollars. Elsewhere, a professional wrestler appears at an appraisal.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Question master Stephen Fry continues the comedy quiz's exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he asks a range of fiendish questions on the theme of landmarks. Joining regular panellist Alan Davies are comedienne Jo Brand, Australian stand-up Colin Lane and comedy writer and actor David Mitchell, who are all hoping they don't fall into the QI elves' traps and set off the klaxon.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy quiz show, hosted by Dara O Briain. Regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of guests Tom Allen, Ed Byrne, Rhys James, Milton Jones and Deborah Frances-White. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Question master Stephen Fry continues the comedy quiz's exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he asks a range of fiendish questions on the theme of long-lost things. Joining regular panellist Alan Davies are Madness frontman Suggs, Australian comedienne Claudia O'Doherty and stand-up Jimmy Carr, who are all hoping they don't fall into the QI elves' traps and set off the klaxon.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Question master Stephen Fry continues the comedy quiz's exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he asks a range of fiendish questions on the theme of landmarks. Joining regular panellist Alan Davies are comedienne Jo Brand, Australian stand-up Colin Lane and comedy writer and actor David Mitchell, who are all hoping they don't fall into the QI elves' traps and set off the klaxon.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Angela Scanlon, Clive Myrie, Sara Pascoe and Rick Edwards test their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games this week, with the daily winner declared following a quick-fire round at the end of the show.

programme.title: Mock the Week

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Nottinghamshire Bodycam Cops Annie and Dave investigate a disturbance in a back garden, but when an intruder turns violent, Annie is left with a life-changing injury.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The picking gets red, hot and blue in a Louisiana warehouse as Mike makes a move on Gypsy Grandma, the queen of arcade games.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Jesse are forced to team up and help each other to gamble on a once-in-a-lifetime locker.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori are torn between what could be a massive haul courtesy of a studio props supplier, and an auction across town.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank discover a fleet of amazing concept cars, some so unique they do not know how to price them.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank find a mysterious wooden box on a large property, but cannot identify what it is. Fortunately, an appraiser is on hand to help them out.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: The crew get creative when tasked with an iron-worker themed rat rod that doubles as a work truck, while Steve tries to flip a beat-up 1967 Coronet found in a junkyard.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson tries out the Lotus T125, which brings F1-style performance to the track, and an updated version of the classic Jensen Interceptor. Bob Geldof gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car, and the trio employ all manner of second-hand military equipment to knock down a row of derelict houses, aiming to complete the job in less time than a team of demolition experts.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Complaints by neighbours about anti-social behaviour leads to a raid on a suspected drugs den in Burton. Documentary series following the work of the Staffordshire Police force.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: Major body work is needed when the suspension and engine don't fit the Haunted Rod. Steve flips a 1920 Old Wayne Gas Pump to offset extra labour costs.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May set out for the seaside in electric cars the Nissan Leaf and Peugeot iOn, stopping off in Lincoln along the way. Louis Walsh gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car, Richard Hammond meets an extraordinary rally team in which everyone, from mechanics to drivers, is an amputee with a military background, and the Lamborghini Aventador is taken out on the track.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May compete in a 1950s-style race from London to Edinburgh. On the footplate of the A1 Tornado steam train, Jeremy has to feed the boiler with a constant supply of coal, while Richard braves the saddle of a Vincent Black Shadow motorbike and James drives an old Jaguar XK120 as the trio discover what Top Gear might have been like 60 years ago. Michael Schumacher drives the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Bill Bailey, Katherine Ryan and Rhod Gilbert join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig for an extended edition of the comedy quiz show. This time, Sandi turns attention to topics on the theme of 'Operations'. During the course of the show, the panellists find out how to turn a muffin into an offensive weapon. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window, as the fiendishly difficult questions lead to points being awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Angela Scanlon, Clive Myrie, Sara Pascoe and Rick Edwards test their general knowledge skills in more trivia-based games, with the winner announced on Friday.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: TV presenters Alex Jones and Rick Edwards, comedian Greg Davies and performance poet John Cooper Clarke join forces with team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the panel show in which participants attempt to deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedian Alan Davies, quiz show guru Richard Osman, writer Germaine Greer and footballer Jermaine Jenas bolster the efforts of team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the panel show in which participants attempt to deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Dara O Briain, Nina Conti and Danny Bhoy
programme.desc: The stand-up comedy show has Dara O Briain warming up the crowd before introducing routines by ventriloquist extraordinaire Nina Conti and the irrepressible Danny Bhoy.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Joe Thomas grapples grumpily with some awkward hand-wear, Sian Gibson seems to find proof that she may be psychic and Iain Stirling shows some tasty shortbread who's boss.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts the quiz that tests the most obscure parts of contestants' general knowledge, awarding points for interesting answers as well as correct ones. Regular panellist Alan Davies is joined by Bill Bailey, Jimmy Carr and Only Connect host Victoria Coren Mitchell to answer fiendish questions on the topic of jargon.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry unleashes a batch of fiendishly puzzling questions to test the general knowledge - or ignorance - of Jo Brand, Liza Tarbuck, Sue Perkins and regular panellist Alan Davies, who reveal what they know about topics including jelly, jam and juice.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Barker and Corbett present more classic comedy sketches, with a song from Tina Charles and another episode in the gripping period drama Hampton Wick.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Vintage sketches from Messrs Barker and Corbett, including Fancy Dress Party, Smart Cooking with Lionel Smart, and classic serial Hampton Wick. With music from Tina Charles.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates this documentary chronicling events leading up to the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbour on December 7, 1941, and the subsequent collapse of unprepared British forces before the advancing enemy in Singapore. Includes interviews with veterans from both sides.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the Airbus A380, which as the largest passenger plane ever built can carry more than 850 people non-stop nearly half-way around the world. With the largest wingspan of any commercial aircraft and four specially developed mighty turbo jet engines, the A380 weighs 560 tonnes and getting it off the ground would not have been possible without the work of past innovators such as George Cayley and Frank Whittle. Key developments in aerospace engineering - from Richard Whitcombe's energy-efficient wing-tip designs to Nasa engineers' cutting-edge control system, Fly by Wire - helped bring the A380 to fruition.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: The detective and sidekick Jardine investigate when a prominent loan shark dies after being brutally attacked with an axe. Jardine starts a relationship with an actress who is playing Lizzie Borden in the studio that owns the apparent murder weapon as the duo come to believe it may be a revenge killing - and that there could be a link with Glasgow's Garden Festival. Celia Imrie guest stars, with Mark McManus and James Macpherson.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Beatrice considers her future with Jack and leaves Evie dumbfounded by accepting Larry Cotter's proposal to join forces and venture into ready-to-wear.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the Old Mill Herbary at Bodmin, Cornwall, where a wide range of herbs and medicinal plants are cultivated.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Eleanor and Nurse Carr carry out tuberculosis tests in the East End slums, while Robert's electro-therapy treatment causes problems. Period drama, starring Jemma Redgrave.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The soldiers help to rescue hostages in the African state of Mokindi. Meanwhile, Sadie and Paul are reunited. Starring Robson Green and Duncan Bell.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Tough former Met officer PC Roger Valentine joins the team and immediately makes a good impression by cracking down on muggings in the Sun Hill area - but his old-fashioned attitude toward homosexuality threatens to ruffle a few feathers when he's partnered with Lance. Jim continues to struggle with his gambling addiction and chilling CCTV footage of Abi makes Samantha fear for her daughter's safety.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Rosie is injured while chasing a thief out of the hospital, and undergoes an emergency operation - which leads to a startling revelation. Tricia faces her first day of chemotherapy and receives a grovelling apology from Carlos, who reveals he left her because he couldn't cope with her illness. Lisa is given the job of clinical matron on a trial basis, and Owen chooses Donna's birthday party as the perfect moment to publicly accept Diane's marriage proposal.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A cleric attacks the driver whose car hit his sister and niece while he was drunk at the wheel, and a six-year-old girl is injured running into a greenhouse. Jude tries to tell Matt she is pregnant, but changes her mind after learning he has been asked to run a bar in Crete.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Kerry Young's funeral casts a sombre shadow over Sun Hill as the team gather to pay their last respects to their colleague, but any hopes of a dignified send-off are dashed by an emotional outburst from Gabriel. Debt-ridden Jim fears an investigation into illegal goings-on at the greyhound track will expose his own complicity, while the close professional relationship between Jack and Debbie turns personal.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: When a builder's estimate makes Frank see red, he decides to attempt some DIY.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pat is shocked when she finds out that Mandy has being lying to her.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Drama series following the lives of the heroic Blue Watch at Blackwall fire station..

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Jane helps the roguish antiques dealer search for a valuable Yeats painting in Ireland, until a more important matter captures their attention. Ian McShane stars.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: A private meeting of European financiers attracts the attention of three criminals, who break into the venue to rob the delegates. Detective drama, guest starring Patrick Allen, with John Nettles and Terrence Alexander.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Leonora announces she is pregnant, Lilo Lil brings Nellie news of Freddie's whereabouts, and Grandad dreams about his funeral. Last-ever episode of Carla Lane's sitcom.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Miss Brahms becomes the store spokesperson when Grace Brothers tries out closed-circuit advertising. Comedy, with Wendy Richard, Mollie Sugden and John Inman.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean and Lionel at last fulfil their dream and take a romantic trip to Paris - but it seems they are not alone. Bob Larbey's comedy about late-blossoming love, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg, Truly, Alvin and Billy encounter a stranger who is determined to travel by canal to Ilkley in an inflatable swan. However, when punctures disrupt the man's dream, Entwistle is on hand to ensure the voyage goes to plan. Tommy Cannon and Bobby Ball guest star.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: It's 1969 and six months since the shootings in Durham Cathedral, and while Gently is almost back to full fitness, Bacchus has lost his confidence and tenders his resignation. Gently is determined to help his sergeant, so he gets him involved in one last case, the death in custody of a man arrested during a street protest - an investigation that leaves both detectives questioning what it means to be a police officer at a time when attitudes to the force are changing. Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby star, with Lisa McGrillis, Steve Evets and Ruth Gemmell.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Part two of two. Danny takes Gerry on the run as they search for the proof they need to prove his innocence - despite Gerry remaining tight-lipped about his involvement with dodgy dealings in his old unit. The stakes are high as the Unsolved Crime and Open Case Squad goes after one of the biggest crime families in London, and it's those closest to Gerry who are dangerously put in the firing line. Starring Dennis Waterman, Nicholas Lyndhurst, Tamzin Outhwaite and Denis Lawson.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: The body of a woman is discovered in woodland and all evidence points to suicide, but Taggart's suspicions are shared by the victim's sister who thinks her brother-in-law is responsible. Detective drama, starring Mark McManus.

programme.desc: Adam Boulton tackles post-Brexit politics with probing interviews and passionate debate about the big issues of our time.

programme.title: Welcome to HMP Belmarsh with Ross Kemp
programme.desc: Part one of two. The documentary maker goes inside the walls of HMP Belmarsh, the country's most notorious maximum-security jail, which has housed the country's most dangerous - and infamous - convicts, including Ian Huntley, Ronnie Biggs and Charles Bronson. Ross explores how staff cope with high-profile inmates, extremists and common criminals living side-by-side and goes inside the High Security Unit, where he meets Muhammad Asif Hafeez, known as Sultan, the alleged mastermind of a drug-smuggling empire.

programme.title: Rebound
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher hosts the quickfire quiz that tests the general knowledge of six contestants, who go head to head in a bid to walk away with a big cash prize. The players must give as many correct answers as they can in the time it takes the 'Rebound Bar' to move across the studio, with the money on offer rising accordingly.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The chef's journey continues along the Canal du Midi in southern France, starting in Carcassonne, where he joins the tourists taking in the sights and doing a little shopping. After cooking up a delicious fish stew on the banks of the canal, James hops aboard a boat for a trip towards the coast and is treated to a traditional cuttlefish lunch cooked in the boat's tiny kitchen.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom..

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: More celebrity interviews and topical debate from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: The dealers head to Wolverhampton, where a Vienna plate comes to Tony Geering's table, Henry Nicholls is led a merry dance over some gold, and Karen Dalmeny gets to wear some very fetching head gear.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a team of university friends answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a Â£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Paul, Stewart, Lucy and Julia pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Aaron gives Liv cause for concern, Cain is surprised by Moira, and Jai's stress levels rise.

programme.title: The Metro: A Rail Life Story
programme.desc: Documentary following workers on the Tyne and Wear Metro - the UK's largest metro system outside of London. In the first edition, staff in Sunderland prepare for the arrival of 50,000 Spice Girls fans ahead of the pop group's concert at the Stadium of Light. The pressure rises across the day as head of operations Wayne spots a potential fault with an overhead line, and there's an anxious call to the control room - a set of fans have lost their tickets for the concert of a lifetime. Narrated by Zoe Hakin.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Things take a gruesome turn when Ferabbees Circus comes to town, bringing with it a chain of sinister clown sightings, threatening notes and deathly dangerous circus acts. Barnaby has to face up to his fears in order to solve the case. Drama, starring Neil Dudgeon, Nick Hendrix, Lorraine Ashbourne and Annette Badland.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's headlines from a Scottish perspective, plus local news from Aberdeen, Edinburgh and Glasgow.

programme.title: White House Farm
programme.desc: Six-part drama based on the true story of the mass murder of a family in an Essex farmhouse in August 1985, providing a fresh insight into these tragic events. In the early hours of August 7th 1985, Nevill and June Bamber were shot and killed inside their farmhouse, along with their adoptive daughter, Sheila Caffell, and Sheila's six-year-old twin sons, Daniel and Nicholas Caffell. Police receive a call from the only surviving member of June and Nevill's immediate family, their adoptive son Jeremy. At first, it appears to be an open-and-shut case to investigating officer DCI Thomas 'Taff' Jones, but for DS Stan Jones, something does not feel right.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: King Crab season kicks off with a 12 million pound Bairdi quota increase that causes a fishing frenzy. Plus, a boat is stolen the night before launch.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer lands a Ford Escort Mk1 for Â£4,500 in an internet auction, and he and Edd China get to work on giving the classic 1970s car a new lease of life with a retro refit.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini checks out a 1933 Duesenberg SJ that has not been taken out on the road for 30 years, and hopes a heated garage has done a good job of keeping the vehicle in top shape.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini flies to Georgia on the orders of a client seeking a 69 ZL-1 Coupe Chevrolet Camaro, and attend the sale of Milt Robson's muscle car collection.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that capture a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that has captured a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Catastrophic flooding topples a hotel, a passenger falls from a hot-air balloon and dozens of drums filled with chemicals burst into flames. Presented by Ron Pitts.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Two cranes collapse at a construction site, there is a spectacular crash on a notorious ski run and a firework explosion shatters windows. Presented by Ron Pitts.

programme.title: American Loggers
programme.desc: The crews are pushing hard as winter sets in, but three drivers suffer accidents. Meanwhile, Allen thinks he needs a raise, but Jeff stands firm.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: The team takes on the challenge of restoring a man's 1968 Firebird, which has been sitting in his parents' garage while he served in Iraq and Afghanistan.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The manufacture of ball bearings, cartoonists' ink and false eyes.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Blacksmith Neville has his expert skills tested with the restoration of a cast iron 19th-century fireplace. Plus, Alex restores a 1930s table into a farmhouse centrepiece.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The Rollo endures rough seas, while the men of the Aleutian Ballad are left in darkness when their vessel is almost capsized by a huge wave. The boats head back to the harbour, where crew members find out how much they will be paid before returning home.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Following a team of dredgers based in Nome, Alaska, trying to collect gold from the bottom of the unpredictable Bering Sea.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Jonny Rayner faces a difficult choice, as he decides whether to cross a crocodile-infested river or delay his journey.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike and Ant reminisce about the experiences they have had in the series, including bonus footage, hilarious outtakes, and fascinating processes.

programme.title: Supertruckers
programme.desc: The Kings Heavy Haulage team returns as the drivers' skills are tested by challenging loads of expensive cargo, beginning with two aircraft wings for Airbus.

programme.title: Secrets of the Underground
programme.desc: Rob Nelson investigates a cluster of ancient ruins in New England that suggest Europeans arrived in the Americas almost 1,000 years before Columbus.

programme.title: Railroad Australia
programme.desc: A super-sized freight train makes its way through the desert wilderness on a 1,900-mile journey to its destination. Plus, Leigh and Wil prove their worth against a crocodile.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.sub-title: Deadliest Catch: Scariest Moments at Sea
programme.desc: Compelling compilation of life and death on the high seas; showcasing some of the world's most dangerous fisheries including Bering Sea crab fishing and offshore lobster fishing..

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Shawn Pomrenke is hurt in a bar brawl and the future of the Christine Rose is put at risk, while the Wild Ranger crew struggles with a leak and an injury to one of the team.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard heads to a manor house in Oxfordshire, where the classic exterior hides a weird and wonderful interior in which he hopes to uncover some priceless gems.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Jared and Johnny's epic mission grinds to a halt, Roscoe battles the elements on a world famous rally, and Turbo is flagged down by the police.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer lands a Ford Escort Mk1 for Â£4,500 in an internet auction, and he and Edd China get to work on giving the classic 1970s car a new lease of life with a retro refit.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: French polisher Alex restores a 1930s rocking horse. Sculptor Nick rescues a mid-century piece and upholsterer Craig attempts to restore a classic Victorian chair.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard heads to Devon, where he finds a wealth of unusual oddities housed in a country pub. He moves on to Hastings, East Sussex, which has enjoyed a recent resurgence in the antiques trade.

programme.title: Born Mucky: Life on the Farm
programme.desc: Rural crime hits Pete and Ally in Herefordshire as thieves strike before harvest. In Cambridgeshire, Tom clashes with a worker, while a huge bull poses a dilemma for farmer Ian.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Eccentric military equipment collector Bruce Crompton and Hus head to freezing Finland following a hot tip. Up near the Arctic Circle there's a kind of Winter Wonderland of Second World War vehicles and equipment..

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Examining how the street lamps of Venice are cast, and how tiny trees are grown for the ancient Chinese art of penjing.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how one of the fastest bikes in the world was created, how pilots train to perform death-defying acrobatics, and how oil and gas is brought up from the bottom of the sea.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: Agents search for a man accused of murdering his wife - but when they discover a friend of the victim has also been killed, they fear the fugitive may have a list of other targets.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Three cases in which investigators had to apply their extensive expertise to apprehend murderers who had killed for money.

programme.title: Copycat Killers
programme.desc: The story of a star student's descent into a seedy underground world. The case dates from 1997 when a teenager re-enacted a movie's most violent scene.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murder of Alabama church woman Dorothy Leatherwood. Rumours in the neighbourhood saw detectives struggle to separate fact from fiction.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The hunt for a racially motivated serial killer - a sniper who murdered at least 20 African-American men but left few clues and no witnesses. A countrywide appeal eventually yielded the number of a Kentucky number plate, and led police to white supremacist Joseph Paul Franklin - who promptly escaped custody. He was finally arrested two months later, having made his way to Tampa, Florida.

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.desc: Officer Kent rescues a neglected puppy whose embedded collar has caused a festering wound. Plus, a troubled young woman steals a golden chow.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown tries to treat a puppy born with a cleft palate, and receives a call from worried lifeguards when snakes hit the beach.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown tries to help a family dog with life-threatening heat stroke, and a terrier with a fear of skateboards. He also needs to collect some alligator saliva.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: I'm Not the Size of a Hanger!
programme.desc: A bride prepares for a beer-themed wedding, while a customer seeks the help of her friends in choosing a dress.
